alert.note: Alert for Coke; Irion; Sterling; Tom Green (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS San Angelo (Central Texas San Angelo)
info.headline: Dust Storm Warning issued March 02 at 3:18PM CST until March 02 at 4:00PM CST by NWS San Angelo
info.description: The National Weather Service in San Angelo has issued a * Dust Storm Warning for... Western Coke County in west central Texas... Sterling County in west central Texas... Western Tom Green County in west central Texas... Irion County in west central Texas... * Until 400 PM CST. * At 317 PM CST, a wall of dust was along a line extending from 12 miles north of Sterling City to 9 miles south of Mertzon, moving east at 40 mph. HAZARD...Less than a quarter mile visibility with damaging wind in excess of 60 mph. SOURCE...Satellite. IMPACT...Dangerous life-threatening travel. Locations impacted include... Sterling City, Mertzon, Broome, Arden, Barnhart, Water Valley, Sherwood, Tankersley, Us-87 Near The Coke- Tom Green County Line and Us-67 Near The Irion- Tom Green County Line. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... Dust storms lead to dangerous driving conditions with visibility reduced to near zero. If driving, avoid dust storms if possible. If caught in one, pull off the road, turn off your lights and keep your foot off the brake. Motorists should not drive into a dust storm. PULL ASIDE STAY ALIVE!
